Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the increase in state spending on education in 2011.
Understate: The claim may be understating the impact of the recession and decreased federal funding on public schools.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough supporting evidence or data to fully substantiate the increase in state spending on education.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the increase in state spending on education was sufficient to address the needs of public schools.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the increase in state spending on education, such as political motivations or other factors not mentioned in the claim.
